intro: Brachystelma sandersonii, commonly known as the sanderson's ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. Brachystelma sandersonii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
